doc.title: Mixed Quarter and Guide; Public Cloud the Bright Spot
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/NetApp Inc. Mixed Quarter and Guide Public Cloud the Bright SpotNetApp Inc. Mixed Quarter and Guide Public Cloud the Bri_2025-08-28

passages.text: NTAP posted an in- line quarter and guide, but product GM misses and Europe and US Federal remained weak. We make little change to our model, and expect product GM to recover while cloud software should remain strong. We reiterate our Overweight rating

FQ1 revenues beat slightly with better product and Public Cloud more than offsetting lower than expected support revenues. Overall GM missed by 40bp as better Services performance was not enough to offset a 150bp miss in product GM. Higher component costs weighed on performance in the quarter. Guidance for FQ2 and FY26 are roughly in- line with our estimates.

Product GM remains a key metric for NTAP, and the last few quarters have been weak. We do believe a return to mid/high 50s is reasonable over the next few quarters. The nearest competitor, PSTG, reported upside and has shown a nice rebound the last two quarters. We believe NTAP had been working through some higher priced component inventory, which is now gone.

We are most encouraged by the top and bottom line performance of the Public Cloud business. Growth excluding the Spot business has been in the high- teens, with first party and marketplace storage growing over \(30\%\) . At \(10\%\) of total sales, this business is now meaningful to the overall revenue stream. The GM range has also been raised to \(80 - 85\%\) .

The numbers: 1FQ26 revenue of \(\) 1,559\(M came in\) 1.6\% \(above our estimate and GM of\) 71.1\% \(was below our\) 71.5\% \(estimate. EPS of\) \ \(1.55\) was one cent above our \(\) 1.54\(estimate. Operating margin beat by 20bp on solid expense management. Product GM continued its slide, although management sees improvements starting next quarter, which we view as reasonable given the better industry backdrop.

Positives: Public cloud revenues (ex- Spot) remained strong at \(\sim 18\%\) growth in the quarter as first party and marketplace storage grew \(33\% y / y\) . Management raised public cloud GM guidance to \(80 - 85\%\) as the business scales. Al wins were meaningful in the quarter with 125 Al and data lake modernization deals in the quarter, more than twice last year. The US commercial business saw growth accelerating to \(\sim 12\%\) in the quarter. Services GM set a multi- year high at \(83.4\%\) .

Concerns: Product GM missed our estimate by 150bp and continued to fall from the high levels seen a year ago. Management blamed component costs, which should improve and lead to a return to mid/high 50s GM. The public sector was weak again, down \(\sim 25\%\) y/y. NTAP has higher exposure than most to Europe at \(32\%\) , and this region was soft again, down \(\sim 2\%\) y/y. AFA is still

growing faster than the rest of the business, but the 6% y/y growth was the lowest we have seen in two years.

**Estimates and rating:** We maintain our OW rating and our PT goes to $125 based on a 15x P/E multiple on FY27 EPS of $8.37. Our prior PT of $117 was based on a 14x P/E multiple on our prior FY27 EPS of $8.35. We continue to believe the cloud business should sustain growth in FY26 and we expect continued strength in AFA business. We expect product GMs to recover through FY26.We raise our multiple on more confidence in the overall storage space, and strong recurring revenues for the company.
NTAP: Quarterly and Annual EPS (USD)

Price (27-Aug-2025) USD 112.13
Price Target USD 125.00

Accelerating and expanding cloud business with higher margin, and growing Services/Recurring revenue as a % of the business. The company is currently trading at a multiple below its early pandemic lows despite the differentiated Cloud business/expanding software share, higher level of services/ recurring revenue, and product GM clarity.

Upside case USD 151.00 Potential upside scenario drivers include: 1) Acceleration in AFA storage demand; 2) Cloud displacement risk moderates further; 3) accelerated services revenue as a result of growing storage installed base; 4) Faster than expected growth in Cloud Data Services.

Downside case USD 102.00 Potential downside scenario drivers include: 1) competitive pressures from Dell/EMC and HPE/Nimble return; 2) demand slowdown becomes worse than expected; 3) cloud displacement risk accelerates; 4) slower-than-expected revenue ramp from Cloud Data Services.
Upside/Downside scenarios

U: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include subordinate voting restricted shares.
V: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include non- voting restricted shares.
Overweight - The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Equal Weight - The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Underweight - The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Positive - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are improving.
Neutral - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
Negative - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are deteriorating.
Below is the list of companies that constitute the "industry coverage universe":

Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research
\*This is the closing price referenced in the publication, which may not be the last available closing price at the time of publication.
Historical stock prices and price targets may have been adjusted for stock splits and dividends.
Valuation Methodology: We use a P/E multiple of 15x on our FY27 EPS estimate of \(8.37 to arrive at our\) 125 price target.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: Downside Risk: The overall storage demand environment remains challenged, and the move to public cloud may hurt NetApp, though some workloads have been moving back, and NetApp is ramping its Public Cloud Data Services business. Competition also remains a risk from DELL as well as Pure Storage, while HP Enterprise is still a relevant player.

Sustainable Investing Related Research: There is currently no globally accepted framework or definition (legal, regulatory or otherwise) of, nor market consensus as to what constitutes a 'sustainable', 'ESG', 'green', 'climate- friendly' or an equivalent company, investment, strategy or consideration or what precise attributes are required to be eligible to be categorised by such terms. This means there are different ways to evaluate a company or an investment and so different values may be placed on certain sustainability credentials as well as adverse ESG- related impacts of companies and ESG controversies. The evolving nature of sustainable investing considerations, models and methodologies means it can be challenging to definitively and universally classify a company or investment under a sustainable investing label and there may be areas where such companies and investments could improve or where adverse ESG- related impacts or ESG controversies exist. The evolving nature of sustainable finance related regulations and the development of jurisdiction- specific regulatory criteria also means that there is likely to be a degree of divergence as to the interpretation of such terms in the market. We expect industry guidance, market practice, and regulations in this field to continue to evolve.
